title: Derivation of organoids from frozen tumour material
title_html: Derivation of organoids from frozen tumour material

protocol.title: Derivation of organoids from frozen tumour material
protocol.title_html: Derivation of organoids from frozen tumour material

source.description: Pour or pipette tissue, and media sample has been transported in, into a glass petri dish.

source.body: If tissue has unknown infection status, only open the container the sample has been transported in within a microbiological safety cabinet.
We recommend using glass rather than plastic petri dishes as tissue can get stuck in grooves cut into the plastic dish whilst cutting up the sample.

source.description:
Aspirate as much media as possible. Add
PBS to wash the tissue sample. Aspirate PBS and repeat wash at least two more times (we perform 3 washes for pancreas and oesophagus and 5 washes for colon).

source.body: If tissue is breaking up, making aspiration difficult without losing the sample, transfer tissue and media back to the tube and centrifuge ( 2 min). Asiprate supernatant and re-suspend in PBS to wash. Repeat these steps for appropriate number of washes.

source.description:
Add
of fresh PBS. Cut the sample up into as small pieces as possible (1-2 mm) using a scalpel.

Transfer tissue and PBS to a
tube. Centrifuge
for 2 minutes.

Aspirate supernatant and re-suspend pellet in
freezing medium (chilled to
) and transfer to a cryovial.

source.body: If there is alot of tissue, split across more than one cryovial. This is to ensure there is sufficient volume of freezing media to protect all tissue pieces during freezing.

source.description:
Place cryovial(s) in a cell freezing container (chilled to
) and transfer immediately to a
freezer.
After 24-72 hours transfer cryovials to liquid nitrogen storage.

Before starting:
Thaw BME2 aliquot overnight at
and dilute 4:1 with appropriate organoid media (tissue specific) to make an 80% stock
Ensure cell culture plates have been stored overnight in
incubator
Pre-warm organoid culture media to

Aliquot
appropriate culture media into a
tube.

Thaw cyrovial(s) of frozen tissue at
until only a small ice crystal remains.

Add
organoid media dropwise to the cryovial(s). Then transfer everything to the
tube containing the remainder of the prepared media.

Centrifuge at
for 2 minutes.

Aspirate the supernatant. Re-suspend the pellet in
freshly prepared digestion buffer.

Place sample in a tube rotator and incubate at
for 60-120 minutes.

Following incubation, assess tissue fragments under a microscope to confirm sufficient digestion. The sample should look cloudy to the eye and appear as single cells or small clumps under a microscope.

Transfer digested sample to a
tube through a
cell strainer. Use a pestle to pass any remaining tissue through the strainer. Wash the
tube with
PBS and add to the
tube through the cell strainer. Repeat the wash step.

Centrifuge at
for 2 minutes.

Aspirate supernatant and re-suspend pellet in
PBS. Repeat spin at
for 2 minutes.

source.body: When aspirating, you do not need to worry about getting too close to the pellet at this stage. The purpose of these washes is to dilute out any remainging Collagenase from the digestion buffer.

source.description:
Aspirate supernatant and re-suspend pellet in
PBS. Transfer to a
tube (or
tube). Wash
tube with another
PBS and transfer to
tube. Repeat spin at
for 2 minutes.

source.body: Transferring to a smaller volume tube helps with re-suspension in a small volume of BME2 in the next step.

source.description:
Aspirate as much supernatant as possible. Re-suspend cell pellet in appropriate amount 80% BME2 (
per well of a 6 well plate).

source.body: BME2 must be dispensed as quickly as possible as it will begin to set at room temperature. A cool block could be used to help keep the temperature down while plating.

Volume of BME2 to re-suspend in must be determined from size of cell pellet. Aim to plate cells as close together as possible. If unsure re-suspend in a small volume. Pipette one or two - droplets and check under the microscope. If too dense increase BME2 volume.

source.description:
Using a P200 pipette, dispense organoid/BME2 suspension as small
-
droplets into a 6 well plate (seed
per well).

Place in a
incubator (5% CO2) for 15-30 minutes to allow BME2 to set.

Prepare media containing antibiotics and Y-27632 (rock inhibitor). Add volumes below per ml of appropriate culture media:
primocin
penicillin-streptomycin
Y-27632 (10mM stock)

Add
of appropriate prepared media per well of a 6 well plate.
Return to incubator. Media change twice a week until ready to passage. Keep in media containing antibiotics and Y-27632 until first passage.

materials.name: ART™ Barrier Specialty Pipette Tips, 1000, wide bore
Nunc™ Biobanking and Cell Culture Cryogenic Tubes, 1.8mL, 48mm, external thread, printed
Cultrex® Reduced Growth Factor Basement Membrane Matrix Type 2 (BME 2)
Costar 6-well Clear TC-treated Multiple Well Plates Bulk Packed Sterile

description: This protocol describes the cryopreservation and subsequent derivation of organoid models from tumour tissue. It has been developed by the organoid derivation team within the Cellular Generation and Phenotyping Group at the Wellcome Sanger Institute. We have used the process to derive organoids from colon and pancreas tumours. In our experience success rates were very low for derivation from frozen oesophageal tumour tissue. The team has extensive experience in organoid derivation and have successfully banked over 100 models.
